snippet: Phil Schiliro, the president’s former chief congressional lobbyist, will be returning to the White House for a brief stint to help protect the law from legislative attacks and quiet dissent.
abstract: Phil Schiliro, Pres Obama's former chief congressional lobbyist, is returning to the White House for a brief stint to help protect the health care law from legislative attacks and quiet dissent; he will also be responsible for coordinating with Congress and executive agencies as the administration continues to put law’s wide-ranging policies into effect.
lead_paragraph: Phil Schiliro, the president’s former chief congressional lobbyist, will be returning to the White House for a brief stint to help protect the law from legislative attacks and quiet dissent.

headline.main: Obama Recalls an Aide to Guide Health Care Law
headline.print_headline: Obama Recalls an Aide to Guide Health Care Law

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
